intro: Boehmeria pavonii var. anomala, commonly known as the silverleaf nettle, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes many stinging plants. The plant is characterized by its silvery-white, hairy leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters. This species is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
